Docs.summary: Provides standard facilities for creating and managing a type-safe, ordered collection of objects.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This collection supports standard zero-based indexing.
The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Table.Columns%2A> property provided by the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Table> class returns a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableColumnCollection>. For more information, see [How to: Manipulate a Table's Columns through the Columns Property](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/how-to-manipulate-table-columns-through-the-columns-property.md).

Docs.summary: Appends a specified item to the collection.
Docs.exception: Raised when already belongs to a collection.

MemberSignature.Value: public int Capacity { get; set; }
.property instance int32 Capacity
Public Property Capacity As Integer
public: property int Capacity { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.Capacity : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the pre-allocated collection item capacity for this collection.
Docs.value: The pre-allocated collection item capacity for this collection. The default value is 8.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableColumnCollection.Capacity%2A> property represents the number of pre-allocated slots for storing items in this collection, whereas the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableColumnCollection.Count%2A> property represents the actual number of items currently in the collection. The value of <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableColumnCollection.Capacity%2A> is always at least as large as the value of <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableColumnCollection.Count%2A>.
When newly added collection items cause the collection count to exceed the collection capacity, the capacity is automatically increased to accommodate the newly added collection items. Increasing the collection capacity involves allocating additional collection slots, which incurs both performance and memory overhead. Use the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableColumnCollection.Capacity%2A> property to optimize the collection capacity in cases where the total or maximum number of collection items is known in advance. Use the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableColumnCollection.TrimToSize%2A> method to cause the collection capacity to equalized with the current collection count.

Docs.exception: Raised when an attempt is made to set to a value that is less than the current value of .

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Clear() cil managed
Public Sub Clear ()
public: virtual void Clear();
abstract member Clear : unit -> unit override this.Clear : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: Clears all items from the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks After calling <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableColumnCollection.Clear%2A>, the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableColumnCollection.Count%2A> property becomes **0** and the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableColumnCollection.Capacity%2A> property is unchanged. To set a new capacity, call <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableColumnCollection.TrimToSize%2A> or explicitly set a new capacity through the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableColumnCollection.Capacity%2A> property.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableColumnCollection.Count%2A> equals <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableColumnCollection.Capacity%2A> for this collection, the collection capacity automatically is increased before the new item is inserted. Set `index` equal to the value of <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TableColumnCollection.Count%2A>, to append a new collection item to the collection.
Indices for existing collection items may be adjusted to accommodate the newly inserted collection item.

MemberSignature.Value: public void TrimToSize ();
.method public hidebysig instance void TrimToSize() cil managed
Public Sub TrimToSize ()
public: void TrimToSize();
member this.TrimToSize : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: Optimizes memory consumption for the collection by setting the underlying collection equal to the of items currently in the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method can be used to minimize memory overhead for a collection, particularly if the set of items contained by the collection is expected to be static.
